Class PixelOperations

java.lang.Object
PixelOperations
public class PixelOperations
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    PixelOperations()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void adjustAll​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, int x)
    This method adjusts all color values by a specified percentage.
    void adjustBlue​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, int x)
    This method adjusts all blue values by a specified percentage.
    void adjustGreen​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, int x)
    This method adjusts all green values by a specified percentage.
    void adjustRed​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, int x)
    This method adjusts all red values by a specified percentage.
    void blur​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method produces a blur effect by averaging the RGB values of surrounding pixels.
    void brg​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method rotates the color 240 degrees clockwise on the color wheel.
    void chroma​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, java.awt.Color[][] arr2)
    This method replaces a region of similar color in one image with part of another image.
    void decode​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method reveals an encoded message.
    void edge​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method attempts to find edges based on the distances between RGB values in 3-dimensional space.
    void encode​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, java.awt.Color[][] arr2)
    This method encodes a message of the user's choosing within the RGB values of the image.
    void flipLR​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method flips the left and right halves of the image.
    void flipUD​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method flips the top and bottom halves of the image.
    void gbr​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method rotates the color 120 degrees clockwise on the color wheel.
    java.awt.Color[][] getArray​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
    This method returns a two-dimensional matrix containing the RGB values of every pixel in the image.
    void gray​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method takes the average of the RGB values for a pixel, then sets that value as the red, green, and blue values.
    void mirrorDU​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method makes the top half of the image a mirror of the bottom.
    void mirrorLR​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method makes the right half of the image a mirror of the left.
    void mirrorRL​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method makes the left half of the image a mirror of the right.
    void mirrorUD​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method makes the bottom half of the image a mirror of the top.
    void negate​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method sets every pixel's RGB values to 255 - (current value).
    void pixelate​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method pixelates the image by creating 10x10 blocks that are all the same color.
    void posterize​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method sets the RGB values of a pixel based on which range the current values fall into: 0-63, inclusive: 32 64-127, inclusive: 96 128-191, inclusive: 160 191-255, inclusive: 224
    void redeye​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method detects red-eye coloration and removes it.
    void sepia​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method uses Microsoft's recommended formula to add a sepia tint.
    void setImage​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img, java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method updates the image with new color values.
    void splash_blue​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly blue, i.e.
    void splash_green​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly green, i.e.
    void splash_red​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly red, i.e.
    void sunsetize​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method adds a red "sunset"-like tint by decreasing the green and blue values of every pixel.
    void zeroBlue​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method sets the blue value of every pixel in the image to zero.
    void zeroGreen​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method sets the green value of every pixel in the image to zero.
    void zeroRed​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
    This method sets the red value of every pixel in the image to zero.

  • Method Details

    • getArray

      public java.awt.Color[][] getArray​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
      This method returns a two-dimensional matrix containing the RGB values of every pixel in the image.
      Parameters:
      img - the image to get color for
      Returns:
      matrix with all color values

    • setImage

      public void setImage​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img, java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method updates the image with new color values.
      Parameters:
      img - image to modify
      arr - matrix of updated color values

    • zeroRed

      public void zeroRed​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method sets the red value of every pixel in the image to zero.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • zeroGreen

      public void zeroGreen​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method sets the green value of every pixel in the image to zero.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • zeroBlue

      public void zeroBlue​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method sets the blue value of every pixel in the image to zero.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • negate

      public void negate​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method sets every pixel's RGB values to 255 - (current value).
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • gray

      public void gray​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method takes the average of the RGB values for a pixel, then sets that value as the red, green, and blue values.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • sepia

      public void sepia​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method uses Microsoft's recommended formula to add a sepia tint.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • blur

      public void blur​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method produces a blur effect by averaging the RGB values of surrounding pixels.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • posterize

      public void posterize​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method sets the RGB values of a pixel based on which range the current values fall into:
      • 0-63, inclusive: 32
      • 64-127, inclusive: 96
      • 128-191, inclusive: 160
      • 191-255, inclusive: 224
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • splash_red

      public void splash_red​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly red, i.e. their red value is greater than or equal to the sum of their green and blue values.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • splash_green

      public void splash_green​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly green, i.e. their green value is greater than or equal to the sum of their red and blue values.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • splash_blue

      public void splash_blue​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method grays out all pixels except those that are predominantly blue, i.e. their blue value is greater than or equal to the sum of their red and green values.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • mirrorLR

      public void mirrorLR​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method makes the right half of the image a mirror of the left.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • mirrorRL

      public void mirrorRL​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method makes the left half of the image a mirror of the right.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • mirrorUD

      public void mirrorUD​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)

      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

      public void mirrorDU​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)

      public void pixelate​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method pixelates the image by creating 10x10 blocks that are all the same color.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • sunsetize

      public void sunsetize​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method adds a red "sunset"-like tint by decreasing the green and blue values of every pixel.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • redeye

      public void redeye​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method detects red-eye coloration and removes it.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • edge

      public void edge​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method attempts to find edges based on the distances between RGB values in 3-dimensional space.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • encode

      public void encode​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, java.awt.Color[][] arr2)
      This method encodes a message of the user's choosing within the RGB values of the image.
      Parameters:
      arr - original image
      arr2 - message to be encoded

    • decode

      public void decode​(java.awt.Color[][] arr)
      This method reveals an encoded message.
      Parameters:
      arr - matrix of colors to modify

    • chroma

      public void chroma​(java.awt.Color[][] arr, java.awt.Color[][] arr2)
      This method replaces a region of similar color in one image with part of another image.
      Parameters:
      arr - image to be modified
      arr2 - image to be substituted in
